item.title: What is ISDN and Why Do I Want It?
item.description:
You might have encountered the term ISDN in the context of phone services. What does it mean and how can it benefit you? ISDN stands for Integrated Services Digital Network, a technical term for a digital phone service that adheres to specific standards. The concept of ISDN emerged when dial-up modems using analog phone lines were the norm for internet access. ISDN aimed to combine phone and internet services on a single line with three channels...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/what-is-isdn-and-why-do-i-want-it/

item.title: PRI Phone Line Connections
item.description:
Analog business phone lines are suitable for small offices and retail spaces that don’t need many outside lines. If you require more than six lines, an option like ISDN PRI might be a better fit. ISDN PRI, which stands for Integrated Services Digital Network Primary Rate Interface, is a standard for transmitting calls digitally over regular phone lines. It’s the larger of two primary options, with the smaller being BRI (Basic Rate Interface)...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/pri-phone-line-connections/
